column4: Is linux very limited on what printers work for it? I want to install a dell printer but its not listed and I cant find the driver?
check the cups.org site and see what they say about the printer.
also a 'dell' printer is proberly just some other comanies printer with a dell logo on it.
could check the output of 'dmesg' when you plug the printer in also.
check the CUPS homepage and see what they say about it. Ubuntu  uses the CUPS printing system
'with CUPS' - Linux has nothing todo with it. :P
and its possible its a clone of some other printer that does work.. try googleing for that 'printer make and linux'
CUPS is the default ubuntu printing software - its allready there.
first hit on google says --->  The Dell 720 can be used with the Lexmark Z615 printer driver
use 'sudo' not 'su -'    -- Its a Ubuntu "feature" for more security
no clue - never used alien.      you may need to do 'sudo alien whatever.rpm'
cuop's web interface is disabled i think by default. you have to use the gnome cups tool.
if you got the driver isntalled - you may need to restart the cups service
perhaps. never noticed. :P  just select file, in the menus and load the roms.
it may of come with a demo/pd rom or 2.
care to give a little more details?
